newsitem.title: USA: John Wilson goes from Staples to Gap.
newsitem.headline: John Wilson goes from Staples to Gap.

text.p: Staples Inc said on Wednesday its Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President for Finance & Strategy John Wilson resigned effective September 15 to become chief administrative officer at The Gap Inc.
In this role, Staples said, Wilson will be responsible for worldwide growth and development, distribution, finance, systems, legal and administrative functions.
John Mahoney, a former Ernst & Young audit partner, has been named CFO of Staples and will report directly to Staples' Chairman and Chief Executive Tom Stemberg.

Also Wednesday Staples said it had a definitive agreement to merge with Office Depot. The two stores issued a statement saying the transaction was intended to be a tax-free exchange of shares in which Office Depot holders would get 1.14 Staples shares for each of their Office Depot shares.

The Gap issued a statement Wednesday saying Wilson, as chief administrative officer and executive vice president, will oversee finance, distribution, legal and real estate functions and report to the company's Chief Executive Millard Drexler.
The Gap's statement said it first announced its intention to hire a CAO a year ago, when it announced that Drexler would become CEO.
Gap Inc operates over 1,750 stores in six countries under the names Gap, GapKids, Banana Republic and Old Navy.
Staples spokeswoman Phyllis Wasserman said Wilson's departure had nothing to do with the merger.
"He had a tremendous opportunity at The Gap and he planned to take it before the merger," she said.
